x86x64::X86X64FuncDeclÂ¶

struct asmjit::x86x64::X86X64FuncDecl
#include <x86func.h>

X86 function, including calling convention, arguments and their register indices or stack positions.

Public Functions

X86X64FuncDecl()

Create a new X86X64FuncDecl instance.

uint32_t getUsed(uint32_t c)

Get used registers (mask).

Note
The result depends on the function calling convention AND the function prototype. Returned mask contains only registers actually used to pass function arguments.

uint32_t getPassed(uint32_t c)

Get passed registers (mask).

Note
The result depends on the function calling convention used; the prototype of the function doesn’t affect the mask returned.

uint32_t getPreserved(uint32_t c)

Get preserved registers (mask).

Note
The result depends on the function calling convention used; the prototype of the function doesn’t affect the mask returned.

const uint8_t * getPassedOrderGp()

Get ther order of passed registers (Gp).

Note
The result depends on the function calling convention used; the prototype of the function doesn’t affect the mask returned.

const uint8_t * getPassedOrderXmm()

Get ther order of passed registers (Xmm).

Note
The result depends on the function calling convention used; the prototype of the function doesn’t affect the mask returned.

ASMJIT_API Error setPrototype(uint32_t conv, const FuncPrototype & p)

Set function prototype.

This will set function calling convention and setup arguments variables.

Note
This function will allocate variables, it can be called only once.

ASMJIT_API void reset()

Public Members

RegMask _used

Used registers .

RegMask _passed

Passed registers (defined by the calling convention).

RegMask _preserved

Preserved registers (defined by the calling convention).

uint8_t _passedOrderGp[kFuncArgCount]

Order of registers defined to pass function arguments (Gp).

uint8_t _passedOrderXmm[kFuncArgCount]

Order of registers defined to pass function arguments (Xmm).
